doctitle.textblock: Columbia Hospital Corporation; Proposed Consent Agreement With Analysis To Aid Public Comment

summary.textblock: In settlement of alleged violations of Federal law prohibiting unfair acts and practices and unfair methods of competition, this consent agreement, accepted subject to final Commission approval, would prohibit, among other things, any hospital combination in the Charlotte County, Florida, area involving Columbia that would threaten competition. The proposed consent agreement would require the respondent to seek prior Commission approval, for ten years, before consummating any partial or total merger of a hospital in the designated area with any other hospital in that area.

date.textblock: Comments must be received on or before April 25, 1994.

address.textblock: Comments should be directed to: FTC/Office of the Secretary, room 159, 6th Street and Pennsylvania Avenue NW., Washington, DC 20580.

supplem.textblock: Pursuant to section 6(f) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 38 Stat. 721, 15 U.S.C. 46 and ยง3.25(f) of the Commission's Rules of Practice (16 CFR 3.25(f)), notice is hereby given that the following consent agreement containing a consent order to cease and desist, having been filed with and accepted, subject to final approval, by the Commission, has been placed on the public record for a period of sixty (60) days. Public comment is invited. Such comments or views will be considered by the Commission and will be available for inspection and copying at its principal office in accordance with ยง4.9(b)(6)(ii) of the Commission's Rules of Practice (16 CFR 4.9(b)(6)(ii)).
